problem_text:
A group G acting on a set Ω will be said to be 1-{2}-transitive if it acts transitively on the set Ω1,{2} = {(α, {β, γ}) | α, β, γ distinct}. Thus G is 1-{2}-transitive if and only if it is transitive and a stabilizer Gα is 2-homogeneous on Ω\ {α}. The problem is to classify all (infinite) permutation groups that are 1-{2}-transitive but not 3-transitive.
P. M. Neumann
